text: this track is so upbeat and happy!

text: oh geez, this game brings back some old times.  hard as nails to say the least.  never did learn to rely on grenades more than the gun
author: pixcalibur123

text: For about 4-5 years as a kid this was the farthest i could get in the game. I couldn't figure out that to get to stage 4 you had to backtrack to the very first screen of the game.
author: Joseph

text:
so good
just from the opening drums i know what the song is, if i couldn't already sing it.
author: TheTaskmaster

text:
#1 absolute favorite NES game

a shame the follow ups to this were not as good
author: willisfrkz

text: This is my favorite theme from this game.
author: Alfaz

text: Loved this game back then, very original for the time with its hybrid gameplay mixing platformer and shoot 'em up. I always liked that little tank's design. I haven't tried the remake on the WiiWare, but it looks very nice.
author: SupraDarky

text: Wow, from the screenshot I thought it was a modern indie game with how good its graphics look. Those trees have, like, seven colours!
author: Jirt

text: Hey, it turns out this was a game I was searching for years ago, but couldn't find because I forgot the name! Thanks, SD!
author: Jirt

text:
The remake Sux. Most powerups have been removed. The size of the game is not even half of the original. The level design is like "Duh.. what is leveldesign". Every cave is the same. 
There is never any point in leaving the tank exept for when entering a cave. In the original, there was puzzels and stuff where you had to get out of the tank and risk your life to be able to continue. Non of that is in the remake.
No. Make yourself a favor and DON'T get the remake.
author: MeSako
